ch4.tcp
Class TCPReceiver

java.lang.Object
  ch4.tcp.TCPReceiver
public class TCPReceiver
extends java.lang.Object

This class implements a simple TCP receiver.

Note: If you are in doubt or some of this code is conflicting your textbook, please check the ultimate sources: RFC 2581 and RFC 2001.
Do not rely on any textbooks for precise details!
Read the textbook(s) for high-level understanding of the material; read the RFCs for precise details.

Author:
Ivan Marsic

Field Detail

lastBufferedIdx

protected int lastBufferedIdx
Index of the last segment that has been buffered. -1 means: There are no buffered segments. Keep in mind that because this is an array index, the zero value indexes the first element of the array.

lastByteRecvd

protected int lastByteRecvd
The field records the last byte received in-sequence. Recall that the bytes are numbered from zero, so the sequence number of the first byte is zero, etc.

nextByteExpected

protected int nextByteExpected
The next byte currently expected from the sender. Recall that the bytes are numbered from zero, so the sequence number of the first byte is zero, etc.

rcvBuffer

protected TCPSegment[] rcvBuffer
The receiver buffer to buffer the segments that arrive out-of-sequence.

rcvWindow

protected int rcvWindow
Receive window size, in bytes.

Constructor Detail

TCPReceiver

public TCPReceiver()
Constructor.

Method Detail

checkBufferedSegments

protected void checkBufferedSegments()
Helper method, checks if the newly received segment(s) fill the gaps for the segments that were previously received out-of-sequence and are stored in a temporary storage ("buffered"). These segments are waiting for the gap to be filled. Once an arriving segment fills the gap, the first buffered segment will become "next expected segment". That is the condition for which this method checks. If what is currently the "next expected segment" is one of the buffered segments that have been received earlier, picks that segments up now and removes it from the receive buffer.

getRcvWindow

public int getRcvWindow()
Accessor for retrieving the current size of the available buffer space, in bytes.

Returns:
Returns current size of the available buffer space, in bytes.

outOfSequenceSegment

protected TCPSegment outOfSequenceSegment(TCPSegment segment_)
Helper method to handle the out-of-sequence segments. Such segments are buffered in the #rcvBuffer. The returned value will be a duplicate acknowledgement.

Parameters:
segment_ - The segment that is currently being processed (i.e., the seq. num. of the segment's last byte).
Returns:
Returns the acknowledgement segment for the input data segment.

receive

public int receive(TCPSegment[] segments_,
                   TCPSegment[] acks_)
Receives the segments from the sender, passes the ones that arrived in-order to the application. Buffers the ones that arrived out-of-sequence. The receiver returns cumulative acknowledgements, which means that if the newly received segment fills the gap created by out-of-sequence segments that were received earlier, the cumulative ACK will acknowledge those earlier segments, as well.

The value null of the segments_ input array element means that the corresponding segment was lost in transport (i.e., at the Router).

Parameters:
segments_ - The received segments array.
acks_ - The acknowledgements array, to be formed in this method and returned.
Returns:
Returns the current size of the receive window, #rcvWindow.
See Also:
Router
